Topic.Title: HOW STUPID IS THIS? BAC $9.71 last year with 10.3 billion Q2 loss and $7.31 this yr with 1.4 billion Q2 GAIN!!!

Message.Msg: I explain it as the shorts collectively covered, took their profits, and then let off of shorting in order to allow the market to get back to a higher nicely shortable level again for double the profit another time around. That nonsense did not get stopped in its tracks until the SEC put into effect a functional uptick rule later in the 1930's. I don't think we will see much SIGNIFICANT improvement here again until a MULTICENT uptick rule is enacted again!!!! DYODD JMHO

Topic.Title: HOW STUPID IS THIS? BAC $9.71 last year with 10.3 billion Q2 loss and $7.31 this yr with 1.4 billion Q2 GAIN!!!

Message.Msg: THERE SHOULD BE A MORATORIUM and FREEZE placed on those sophisticated complex derivatives and just stop the nonsense. This could easily be done through global accords. Case in point. Remember when the guy who invented "pyramid selling" was voted Business Man of the Year? Guess what, not long after that, the technique was made illegal. Just work on making complex opaque derivatives "illegal" and freeze them with a global moratorium where they are. That would have been better than all these bailouts and exponential growth to trillions of dollars of soverign debt growth. DYODD JMHO

Message.Title: BAC Stands to Lose Millions over Credit Card Ruling
Message.Msg: Consumers will not pay a credit card price for goods and services. Instead, consumers will revolt and go back to paying bills with cash. BAC stands to lose millions of dollars. Wise investors are aware of this, and this is one more reason why BAC stock has not taken off.

Message.Title: QE3 PURE POLITICS AS STOCKS SURGE $1.5 TRIL ON QE2 EXCESS CASH
Message.Msg: I am always amazed that stock prices can easily surge trillions of dollars on HOPES of the Fed Res printing more free money via QE3 when the current trillion plus dollar stock surge proves there is a ton of EXCESS cash FLOODING the world already. World banks printed over $16 trillion in the past few years (this is equal to the total US economy), yet the jobless rate in US is 8.2% and 25% in some parts of Europe. Housing prices hardly budged over this time period. So what is the purpose of printing more money via QE3? Pure politics, if Bernake implements QE3 he will establish a new role for the Fed Res to manipulate US elections. Bernake already manipulates: interest rates, FX exchange rates by buying Euros and weakening the US dollar, stock market through buying bad mortgages at full price and easy money policy to banks that don't pass that benefit onto the public, buying $2 trillion US treasuries aka buying US debt and now manipulating election outcomes. Wow, is this still America?

Topic.Title: BAC Stands to Lose Millions over Credit Card Ruling

Message.Msg: Consumers do not know cash....

Topic.Title: QE3 PURE POLITICS AS STOCKS SURGE $1.5 TRIL ON QE2 EXCESS CASH

Message.Msg: There are two important things that keep the world go round; real estates and stocks. Real Estates will continue to depreciate if people's wealth (stocks) does not improve. Although it might sound artificial, the printing of money should ( "has to" might be better words) help create confidence and jobs for millions of suffering unemployed. Our current market is in the game of manipulations and the manipulations (to control inflation from going out of control again) will "eventually" put the world economy back in equalibrium. All and all, the government has no choice but to help the stock markets go up to keep real estates from dropping further. And letting dead beats( most of these people have nothing to contribute to the economy, financially) live for free and decreasing the balances of their mortgage is farthest away from fixing the real problem. Anways, if people's wealth can not be recouped from their 401k, IRAs and other private funds in stocks, then "the only choice" is to declare a nuclear war to clean up the mess we have created for ourselves based on greed. That of course, should not happen. Therefore, it is time for the stock market to "consistently" go up. Too many people have lost their life savings, spouses (due to divorces) and morality. We can no longer afford to bring home casualties if we let greedy and corrupted politicians ruin the world. Next Monday could be your last chance to own BAC at a huge discount because the future always depend on the success of banks. Own some BAC while interest rates are still low. Because when they go up, your bank stocks will quadriple in value!

Topic.Title: BAC Stands to Lose Millions over Credit Card Ruling

Message.Msg: Wrong again! In this economy, people are more dependent on credit cards. They need it to pay their other bills by making minimum payments (banks win). Unlike real estates, they have to pay on time or their credit cards will close permanently; giving them no other chances to find a new start (like finding a job, buying time to save their house or rental housings). Good luck spreading negativtity around the world. If not already, you will be the first to be forgotten.

Topic.Title: BAC Stands to Lose Millions over Credit Card Ruling

Message.Msg: Wow, really? Millions??? Let me see, for a company with BAC's size, how small of a fraction of a part of a percent is that? IT IS NOTHING!!! It is your hapless speculation. No, I take that back, it is not even speculation, it is a BAC hater fabricating a reason to bash, and it is not a factor for where BAC pps is. It is the economy, the fiscal cliff and the EU - every expert says that, nobody who knows anything says the stupid stuff you say.THE BOTTOM LINE IS THAT CREDIT CARD FEES WILL NOT HURT BAC ONE BIT BECAUSE 1)THE CONSUMERS WHO HAVE NO CASH AND LIVE ON CREDIT WILL CONTINUE TO DO SO AND HAVE NO CHOICE BUT TO PAY THE FEES, AND 2) THOSE WITH MONEY WHO PAY OFF THIER CC BILLS EACH MONTH WON'T CARE ABOUT THE SILLY FEE. GOOD FOR BAC IF THEY LOSE MORE DEADBEAT CUSTOMERS AND KEEP CUSTOMERS THAT PAY THEIR BILLS. THIS WILL INCREASE BAC PROFITS!!!! CREDIT UNIONS ARE ALREADY FEELING THE HURT FROM DEADBEAT CUSTOMERS WHO HAVE LEFT COMMERCIAL BANKS.

Topic.Title: QE3 CAN'T HAPPEN!!!!

Message.Msg: From Barron's this weekend: "Market fundamentals, including earnings, are mixed, but hope for stimulus is high now, says Michael Yoshikami, chief executive officer of Destination Wealth Management. "QE3 is coming," he adds. Indeed, there is a strong dread among institutional investors in particular of being out of the market ahead of such easing moves." QE3 can happen, and it will.

Message.Title: The QE's are the Fed's rather pitiful attempts to offset
Message.Msg: a little of the demand lost to crashed home equities. Like spitting into the wind. Meanwhile, the Republicans in Congress refuse to allow any meaningful fiscal stimulus, beyond that which was necessary to bail out bank managements and creditors. The U.S. is Japan in '95 and, in the end, our stock market will perform about like their's has. We pretty much followed Keynesian theory though the '90's. Remember how Clinton and the Republican Congress were paying down the deficit during the good times. Then that became politically inexpedient for the right who incurred gov debt to cut taxes and wage silly wars during the housing boom and now refuse to borrow, even at negative real interest rates, to mitigate the bust. Turns out that Maynard was a smart guy.

Topic.Title: Sister In Law Hasnt paid her BAC mortgage in 5 years in NY....still no foreclosure

Message.Msg: This is exactly what is wrong with the economy. You have a bunch of dead beats that are living for free, while hard working people are still struggling to pay their bills on time. All these dead beats are better off than the ones that are responsible, that is just not right! I may end up voting for Romney is this #$%$ keeps up. The banks need to forclose and get it over with, period!

Message.Title: THE SUPREME COURT IS COMPLETELY POLITICAL
Message.Msg: It is amazing how each Supreme Court member, is always telling the American Public how politics does not enter into their decisions. If that was true, then most rulings should be 9-0 for, or against any legal issue brought before it. I can see 8-1, or 8-2 because the law can be construed somewhat differently between the members BUT 5-4, ON ALMOST EVERY CASE? IF THEY ARE LOOKING AT THE SAME LAW, WITHOUT PREJUDICE OR POLITICAL JUDGEMENT, THEN THE OUTCOME SHOULD BE THE SAME FOR ALMOST ALL OF THEM. THEY ARE AS FARCICAL AS THE CONGRESS OR THE PRESIDENT.
